text: Delara Darabi (; September 29, 1986 - May 1, 2009) was a Iranian girl, who was sentenced to death at age of 17. She was convicted of murder, despite her highly probably innocence and was executed by hanging. == Case == Her case raised controversy for a number of reasons: # The Iranian Government had signed the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and Convention on the Rights of the Child, and, according to this, no person under age of 18 could be sentenced to death; however, despite this, Iran had executed number of minors; # Her guilty verdict is disputable: ## She had initially claimed responsibility for having murdered her father's cousin, Mahin Darabi, in order to protect her boyfriend Amir Hussein (age 19), because he told her that, because she was under the age of 18, she could not have a death sentence. What he said was wrong. Amir Hussein received 10 years in prison for being Delara's "accomplice" in Mahin's murder, while Delara was sentenced to death. ## Delara was left-handed, and there is abundant evidence that the murderer was right- handed. Delara's sentence was upheld by Iran's Supreme Court. The only person who could commute the sentence is Iranian Head of Judiciary, Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi. In January 2007, Delara attempted to commit suicide. Darabi was kept in Rasht Prison. According to her family and attorney, she was severely beaten by prison guards and fellow prisoners and left with a broken arm. Conditions in prison were extremely poor, leading Delara to repeatedly file requests to be transferred to another prison with better sanitary and overall conditions. Her requests were not answered. Darabi was also a talented painter, poet and pianist. Her paintings were exhibited in Tehran and, recently, in Amsterdam. She was executed May 1, 2009. == Campaigns to save Darabi == There was a petition online to save Darabi. A similar petition was started by Miss Canada 2003 Nazanin Afshin-Jam for another Iranian minor, Nazanin Fatehi, who was also sentenced to death. After worldwide attention and over 350,000 signatures Nazanin Fatehi was finally found innocent and freed. Amnesty International has also made many public statements and a letter campaign about Darabi. == Personal background == She was born in Rasht (Province of Gilan), where she was a high-school student before her arrest. She had three sisters: Elaheh (21-year old), Ghazale (19) and Sheida (8). Elaheh and Ghazale are college students. Her sisters were also born in Rasht. == Other websites == * Amnesty International April 2007 Urgent Action call about Delara Darabi * Stop Child Executions Campaign page about Delara * SaveDelara campaign * Delara Darabi paintings presentation Category:1986 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Human rights Category:Iranian people Category:Murderers Category:People executed by hanging Category:Gilan Province
